messages.subject: Re:Brikwars and other Lego info
messages.msgSnippet: We do Brikwars!!! We re even putting the finishing touches on an article about it for a future issue of the Connections ezine. DH and DS (8 1/2) love it. If
messages.messageBody:
We do Brikwars!!! We're even putting the finishing touches on an article
about it for a future issue of the Connections ezine. DH and DS (8 1/2)
love it. If you download the BrikWars instructions, the first section is
a 'quick start' where it's a very basic gameplay and then you can go
from there. My guys adjust and modify and add and make up all sorts of
new "rules" to accommodate whatever pieces we have/can build (since we
might not have A but we have B so we adjust for that).

Deb

messages.subject: Brikwars and other Lego info
messages.msgSnippet: While perusing some unschooling sites I came across some Lego lovers who recommended these sites...anyone ever battled with Legos??
messages.messageBody:
While perusing some unschooling sites I came across some Lego lovers who
recommended these sites...anyone ever battled with Legos??

http://www.brikwars.com/index.html

and this site is confusing to me but I did manage to find Lego
directions that have been scanned and other useful info:

http://www.peeron.com/inv

Amy
